definition.sentence: Subjacency Before turning to the Subjacency Principle , a few auxiliary technical terms need to be defined : If we can 243 trace a path up the tree from a given node X to a given node Y , then we say X is dominated by Y , or equivalently , Y dominates X. If Y dominates X , and no other nodes intervene ( i.e. X is a daughter of Y ) , then Y immediately ( or directly ) dominates X. \ [ Akmajian & Heny 7,5\ ] .
definition.definiens: dominates X. If Y dominates X , and no other nodes intervene ( i.e. X is a daughter of Y )

definition.sentence: One non-standard definition will prove useful : I will say that if Y dominates X , and Y is a cyclic node , i.e. an S or NP node , and there is no other cyclic node Z such that Y dominates Z and Z dominates 'X ( i.e. there is no intervening cyclic node Z between Y and X ) then Y Dominates X. The principle of Subjacency , informally stated , says that no rule can involve constituents that are separated by more than one Cyclic node .
definition.definiens: a cyclic node
principle of Subjacency , informally stated , says that no rule can involve constituents that are separated by more than one Cyclic node

MICS ( Mixed-Initiative Conversational System ) is a fully implemented computer program that generates one side of a natural-language conversation .
definition.definiens: a fully implemented computer program that generates one side of a natural-language conversation

definition.sentence: Conversational syntax is a set of rules that help to characterize well-formed conversations .
definition.definiens: a set of rules that help to characterize well-formed conversations

definition.sentence: MICS `` knows '' about itself as a person ( e.g. it believes itself to be a computer programmer ) and uses a model of the other conversational participant that contains certain information about the speaker , such as his social status , his occupation , his relationship with other people and his areas of special interest and more detailed knowledge .
definition.definiens: knows '' about itself as a person ( e.g. it believes itself to be a computer programmer ) and uses a model of the other conversational participant that contains certain information about the speaker

definition.sentence: If MICS knew this fact , then Conversational Syntax Rule ( I0 ) would prevent MICS from warning Dave about getting stoned • Therefore , MICS needs a better mechanism for deciding what knowledge it shares with the other speaker .

definition.sentence: As a process model of conversation , MICS is a useful tool , but it is far from a complete or even an entirely correct model of human conversation .
definition.definiens: a useful tool

definition.sentence: Disclaimer : MICS is a first-pass process model of a theory of conversation , not a theory of learning about other people .
definition.definiens: a first-pass process model of a theory of conversation
